Registration Demo

Lisa DeBruine & Daniel Lakens

2019-04-30

Source: vignettes/demo.Rmd
demo.Rmd

Functional Setup

# set up empty study object
mystudy <- study("IAT Demo")

# add hypothesis 1
mystudy <- add_hypothesis(
  study = mystudy,
  description = "Mean RT will be significantly slower in the incongruent condition compared to the congruent condition.",
  evaluation = "&",
  id = "H1"
)

# add analysis 1
mystudy <- add_analysis(
  study = mystudy,
  func = "t.test",
  params = list(
    x = ".data[1]$incongruent",
    y = ".data[1]$congruent",
    alternative = "two.sided",
    paired = TRUE,
    var.equal = FALSE,
    conf.level = 0.95
  ),
  id = "H1_ttest"
)

# add criterion 1 to hypothesis 1
mystudy <- add_criterion(
  study = mystudy,
  result = "p.value",
  operator = "<",
  comparator = .05,
  hypothesis_id = "H1",
  analysis_id = "H1_ttest"
)

# add criterion 2 to hypothesis 1
mystudy <- add_criterion(
  study = mystudy,
  result = "estimate",
  operator = ">",
  comparator = 0,
  hypothesis_id = "H1",
  analysis_id = "H1_ttest"
)

# add hypothesis 2
mystudy <- add_hypothesis(
  study = mystudy,
  description = "Reaction times for congruent and incongruent trials will be signifiantly and positively correlated.",
  evaluation = "&",
  id = "H2"
)

# add analysis 2
mystudy <- add_analysis(
  study = mystudy,
  func = "cor.test",
  params = list(
    x = ".data[1]$congruent",
    y = ".data[1]$incongruent",
    alternative = "two.sided",
    method = "pearson",
    conf.level = 0.95
  ),
  id = "H2_cor"
)

# add criterion 2 to hypothesis 2
mystudy <- add_criterion(
  study = mystudy,
  result = "p.value",
  operator = "<",
  comparator = 0.05,
  hypothesis_id = "H2",
  analysis_id = "H2_cor"
)

# add criterion 2 to hypothesis 2
mystudy <- add_criterion(
  study = mystudy,
  result = "estimate",
  operator = ">",
  comparator = 0,
  hypothesis_id = "H2",
  analysis_id = "H2_cor"
)

study_save(mystudy, "iat.json")
# generate pre-registration report
study_report(mystudy, template="prereg", filename = "prereg")

Hypotheses

Hypothesis 1

Mean RT will be significantly slower in the incongruent condition compared to the congruent condition.

  • Criterion 1 is confirmed if analysis yields p.value < 0.05
  • Criterion 2 is confirmed if analysis yields estimate > 0

If all criteria are met, this hypothesis is supported.

Hypothesis 2

Reaction times for congruent and incongruent trials will be signifiantly and positively correlated.

  • Criterion 1 is confirmed if analysis yields p.value < 0.05
  • Criterion 2 is confirmed if analysis yields estimate > 0

If all criteria are met, this hypothesis is supported.

Analyses

We will run t.test(x = .data[1]$incongruent, y = .data[1]$congruent, alternative = two.sided, paired = TRUE, var.equal = FALSE, conf.level = 0.95)

We will run cor.test(x = .data[1]$incongruent, y = .data[1]$congruent, alternative = two.sided, paired = TRUE, var.equal = FALSE, conf.level = 0.95)

# add data
n_sub <- 50
dat <- faux::rnorm_multi(n_sub, 2, .5, c(500, 750), 250,
                         c("congruent", "incongruent"))
dat$sub_id = 1:n_sub
mystudy <- add_data(mystudy, dat)

# run analyses
mystudy <- study_analyse(mystudy)
# generate post-registration report
study_report(mystudy, template="postreg", filename = "postreg")

Results

Hypothesis 1

Mean RT will be significantly slower in the incongruent condition compared to the congruent condition.

  • Criterion 1 was p.value < 0.05 in analysis H1_ttest.
    The result was p.value = 0
  • Criterion 2 was estimate > 0 in analysis H1_ttest.
    The result was estimate = 192.278

Conclusion: All criteria were met, this hypothesis was supported.

Hypothesis 2

Mean RT will be significantly slower in the incongruent condition compared to the congruent condition.

  • Criterion 1 was p.value < 0.05 in analysis H2_cor.
    The result was p.value = 0.001
  • Criterion 2 was estimate > 0 in analysis H2_cor.
    The result was estimate = 0.451

Conclusion: All criteria were met, this hypothesis was supported.

Object-oriented setup


mystudy <- study("IAT Demo")  %>%
  add_hypothesis(
    description = "Mean RT will be significantly slower in the incongruent condition compared to the congruent condition.",
    evaluation = "&", id = "H1") %>%
  add_analysis(
    func = "t.test",
    params = list(
      x = ".data[1]$incongruent",
      y = ".data[1]$congruent",
      alternative = "two.sided",
      paired = TRUE,
      var.equal = FALSE,
      conf.level = 0.95
    ),
    id = "H1_ttest"
  ) %>%
  add_criterion(
    result = "p.value",
    operator = "<",
    comparator = .05,
    hypothesis_id = "H1",
    analysis_id = "H1_ttest"
  ) %>%
  add_criterion(
    result = "estimate",
    operator = ">",
    comparator = 0,
    hypothesis_id = "H1",
    analysis_id = "H1_ttest"
  ) %>%
  add_hypothesis(
    description = "Reaction times for congruent and incongruent trials will be signifiantly and positively correlated.",
    evaluation = "&", id = "H2"
  ) %>%
  add_analysis(
    func = "cor.test",
    params = list(
      x = ".data[1]$congruent",
      y = ".data[1]$incongruent",
      alternative = "two.sided",
      method = "pearson",
      conf.level = 0.95
    ),
    id = "H2_cor"
  ) %>%
  add_criterion(
    result = "p.value",
    operator = "<",
    comparator = 0.05,
    hypothesis_id = "H2",
    analysis_id = "H2_cor"
  ) %>%
  add_criterion(
    result = "estimate",
    operator = ">",
    comparator = 0,
    hypothesis_id = "H2",
    analysis_id = "H2_cor"
  ) %>%
  add_data(dat) %>%
  study_analyse()
mystudy %>%
  study_report(template="prereg", filename = "pre") %>%
  study_report(template="postreg", filename = "post")
